Package com.github.liblevenshtein.transducer

Various utilities specifically related to Levenshtein distance, such as distance metrics, transducers, and classes for constructing them.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ICandidateCollection<Type>
    Describes the operations necessary for all collections that hold spelling candidates for query terms.
    IDistanceFunction
    The distance of each position in a state can be defined as follows:
    IMergeFunction
    Defines operations for merging states together.
    IPositionTransitionFunction
    Transitions an input position of a Levenshtein state to all candidate positions, conditioned by a set of parameters.
    IState
    Defines the methods on Levenshtein states, which consist of all possible position vectors at the current index of the spelling candidate.
    IStateTransitionFunction
    Transitions Levenshtein states according to the evidence.
    ISubsumesFunction
    Determines whether the position represented by the combination of parameters in the left half subsumes the position represented by the combination of parameters in the right half.
    ITransducer<CandidateType>
    Returns a collection of spelling candidates for the given query term.
    IUnsubsumeFunction
    Un-subsumes the positions in a state, according to the Levenshtein algorithm in use.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractPositionTransitionFunction
    Implements common logic shared among the position-transition functions, which for their specific algorithm take one of the positions in a state and a few parameters, and return all posible positions leading from that one, under the constraints of the given paramters and the Levenshtein algorithm.
    Candidate
    POJO returned when the distances are requested of the candidate terms from the query term, that are returned from the transducer.
    CandidateCollection<Type> Deprecated
    CandidateCollection.WithDistance
    Implementation of CandidateCollection that includes the distances with the spelling candidates, packaged in Candidates.
    CandidateCollection.WithoutDistance
    Implementation of CandidateCollection that returns only the raw, spelling candidates.
    Element<Type>
    Elements are used to maintain a sorted, linked-list of positions within IStates.
    Intersection<DictionaryNode>
    State along the intersection of the dictionary automaton and the Levenshtein automaton.
    LazyTransducerCollection<DictionaryNode,CandidateType>
    The algorithm for imitating Levenshtein automata was taken from the following journal article:
    MergeAndSplitPositionTransitionFunction
    Transitions a merge-and-split, Levenshtein position to all possible positions, given a set of parameters.
    MergeFunction
    Merges one state into another, according to rules specific to the Levenshtein algorithm.
    MergeFunction.ForStandardPositions
    MergeFunction specific to the standard, Levenshtein algorithm.
    MergeFunction.ForXPositions
    MergeFunction specific to the transposition and merge-and-split, Levenshtein algorithm.
    StandardPositionComparator
    Sorts position vectors for the standard, Levenshtein algorithm.
    StandardPositionDistanceFunction
    Distance function for the standard, Levenshtein distance algorithm.
    StandardPositionTransitionFunction
    Transitions a standard, Levenshtein position to all possible positions, given a set of parameters.
    State
    Levenshtein state that is used by all algorithms.
    StateTransitionFunction
    Transitions one state to another, given a set of inputs.
    SubsumesFunction
    Routines for determining whether one position subsumes another.
    SubsumesFunction.ForMergeAndSplit
    Routines for determining whether a merge-and-split position subsumes another.
    SubsumesFunction.ForStandardAlgorithm
    Routines for determining whether a standard position subsumes another.
    SubsumesFunction.ForTransposition
    Routines for determining whether a transposition position subsumes another.
    Transducer<DictionaryNode,CandidateType>
    This wrapper around LazyTransducerCollection, which handles all the heavy lifting.
    TransducerAttributes<DictionaryNode,CandidateType>
    Attributes required for this transducer to search the dictionary.
    TranspositionPositionTransitionFunction
    Transitions a transposition, Levenshtein position to all possible positions, given a set of parameters.
    UnsubsumeFunction
    Defines methods to remove positions from a Levenshtein state that are subsumed by other positions in that state.
    UnsubsumeFunction.ForStandardPositions
    Removes subsumed positions for standard, Levenshtein states.
    UnsubsumeFunction.ForXPositions
    Removes subsumed positions for transposition and merge-and-split, Levenshtein states.
    XPositionComparator
    Sorts elements for transposition and merge-and-split states.
    XPositionDistanceFunction
    Distance function for the Levenshtein distance algorithms, extended with transposition (standard- and t-positions), and with merge and split (standard- and s-positions).
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Algorithm
    Variants of Levenshtein distance supported by this library.

Package com.github.liblevenshtein.transducer Description

Various utilities specifically related to Levenshtein distance, such as distance metrics, transducers, and classes for constructing them.
Since:
2.1.0
